_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
W. Newell & Company is retail distributor of fresh produce throughout the Midwest. W. Newel's Champaign Distribution Center uses anhydrous ammonia for the refrigeration of produce products in storage. Anhydrous ammonia is subject to U.S. EPA regulation under 40 CFR 68, Accidental Release Risk Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals. W. Newell's Champaign Distribution Center has never experienced a release of ammonia involving consequences that efeected its associates, neigbors or the environment.

Pursuant to RMP Regulations (40CFR68) and the Process Safety Management (PSM) Regulations W. Newell has developed a comprehensive PSM written program to protect employees and the surrounding community from exposure to the hazardous chemicals (anhydrous ammonia)located on site.  The facility completed a process hazard analysis (PHA) for the ammona refrigeration system using the industry standard What-If Checklist analysis develoiped through the International Insitute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR. The PHA was completed usingtechnical and operations staff from the Champaign facility as well experienced facilitators from SuperValu's corporate staff. W. Newell's implementation of the PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and the measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental releases of ammonia.  The plans include preventative maintenance programs (mechanical integrity) for the ammonia system, and a program for both pre-startup safety review and management of Change (MOC)to the system. The program also includes specific requiremsnt for tthe safe work practices (such as safe approaches to welding and similar hot work) and safety requirements.
W.Newell undrtook a review of the potential offiste consequences  of the accidental release of the largest vessel in the system. Although such a release is highly unlikely, the regulation requires this review. W. Newell is committed to minimizing accidental releases from the

refrigeration process at it's Champaign distribution center. Facility management is involved  in the design, operation, and maintenance of the system. W Newell's employees have been involved in the development of the PSM and RMP programs. Management has committed to working with employees regarding the hazards of ammonia and to ensure a safe workplace and surrounding community. Specific questions regarding RMP compliance at W. Newell should be addressed to SuperValu's Environmental Affairs Department. 

The local agency coordinating the facility emergency response plan is the Champaign Fire Department, 217-403-7200.
